intro: Gompholobium pinnatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf wattle, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically has slender, often hairy stems and bipinnate leaves that are narrow and arranged alternately. Its flowers are bright yellow and form in dense spikes, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Gompholobium pinnatum is adapted to various soil types and is often found in coastal and sandy environments.
